soc.baseclient

Class SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.baseclient.SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SOCMessageDispatcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SOCRobotClient

    public abstract class SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements SOCMessageDispatcher
    "Headless" standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer. If you want another connection port, you have to specify it as the "port" argument in the html source. If you run this as a stand-alone, you have to specify the port.

    The SOCRobotClient is based on this client. Because of this, some methods (such as handleVERSION(boolean, SOCVersion)) assume the client and server are the same version.

    Some static methods here are used by SOCPlayerClient and SOCRobotClient, to prevent code duplication.

    Since server and built-in robots are the same version, this client doesn't need game option sync messages (SOCGameOptionInfo) but handles them if sent. Ignores scenario synchronization messages (SOCScenarioInfo). Being GUI-less, it ignores i18n localization messages (SOCLocalizedStrings).

    Before v1.1.20, this class was in the soc.client package. In 1.1.20, for server jar packaging it was moved into a new soc.baseclient package.

    Author:
    Robert S Thomas

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_TRAFFIC

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_TRAFFIC
        Flag property jsettlers.debug.traffic: When present, the contents of incoming and outgoing network message traffic should be debug-printed. Used by this class, SOCRobotClient, and SOCPlayerClient.
        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLIENT_GAMEOPT3P

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLIENT_GAMEOPT3P
        For client/robot testing, string property "jsettlers.debug.client.gameopt3p" with name of a "third-party" Known Game Option to create; will have SOCGameOption.FLAG_3RD_PARTY. At server connect, will report having client feature "com.example.js." + optionName along with default features or SOCPlayerClient.PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLIENT_FEATURES.
        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        SOCServer.PROP_JVM_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_SERVER_GAMEOPT3P, Constant Field Values

      • doc

        protected java.lang.String doc

      • lastMessage

        protected SOCMessage lastMessage

      • nextServerPingExpectedAt

        protected long nextServerPingExpectedAt
        Time when next SOCServerPing is expected at, based on previous ping's SOCServerPing.getSleepTime(), or 0. Repetitive pings' debugTraffic prints should be hidden when the bot is otherwise idle. Receiving other in-game message types resets this to 0.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • serverConnectInfo

        protected final ServerConnectInfo serverConnectInfo
        Server connection info. Robot clients should set non-null ServerConnectInfo.robotCookie when constructing.

        Versions before 2.2.00 instead had host, port, strSocketName fields.

        Since:
        2.2.00
        See Also:
        allOptsReceived

      • knownOpts

        public SOCGameOptionSet knownOpts
        This client's set of Known Options. Initialized from SOCServerGameOptionSet.getAllKnownOptions(), updated by SOCGameOptionInfo messages.
        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        allOptsReceived, handleGAMEOPTIONINFO(SOCGameOptionInfo)

      • allOptsReceived

        protected boolean allOptsReceived
        Since server and built-in robots are the same version, this client doesn't need SOCGameOption synchronization messages. Server still sends them in some conditions, such as when gameopts are limited by client features or when inactive opts have been activated.

        By default assumes true, there's no pending info to receive, because is same version as server. If a gameopt sync message is sent, will set false until the "end of list" marker message is sent.

        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        knownOpts, handleGAMEOPTIONINFO(SOCGameOptionInfo)

        protected Connection connection
        Local server connection, if ServerConnectInfo.memSocketName != null.
        Since:
        1.1.00

        public SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient(ServerConnectInfo sci)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor to set up using this server connect info. Does not actually connect here; subclass methods such as SOCRobotClient.init() must do so.
        Parameters:
        sci - Server connect info (TCP or stringPort); not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sci == null
        Since:
        2.2.00

      • resend

        public void resend()
        resend the last message

      • treat

        protected void treat(SOCMessage mes,
                     boolean didDebugPrintAlready)
        Handle an incoming message. Only called from subclasses.

        For message types relevant to robots and automated clients, update our data from the message contents. Other types will be ignored. Messages of unknown type are ignored.

        Note: SOCRobotClient.dispatch( SOCMessage, Connection ) calls this method as its default case, for message types which have no robot-specific handling. For those that do, the robot dispatch's switch case can call treat(mes) before or after any robot-specific handling. (Before v2.0.00, the bot didn't call this method by default.)

        New message types:
        If the message type is relevant to bots and other automated clients, add it here. If handling differs between the robot client and other automated clients, override it in the sub-classes. This method has a flag parameter used by sub-classes to prevent printing debug messages twice.

        Parameters:
        mes - The message
        didDebugPrintAlready - If true, don't debug print mes.toString() even if D.ebugIsEnabled(). Intended for use from subclasses which would have done that debug print if enabled.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • handleSERVERPING

        protected void handleSERVERPING(SOCServerPing mes)
        handle the server ping message. Echo back to server, to ensure we're still connected.

        Message was ignored before version 1.1.08 (this method was an empty stub). Moved for v2.0.00 from subclass SOCRobotClient.

        protected void handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCPlayerElement mes)

      • handlePLAYERELEMENT

        public static void handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCGame ga,
                                       SOCPlayer pl,
                                       int pn,
                                       int action,
                                       SOCPlayerElement.PEType etype,
                                       int amount,
                                       java.lang.String nickname)
        Handle a player information update from a SOCPlayerElement or SOCPlayerElements message.
        Parameters:
        ga - Game to update; does nothing if null
        pl - Player to update; some elements take null. If null and pn != -1, will find pl using ga.getPlayer(pn).
        pn - Player number from message (sometimes -1 for none or all)
        action - SOCPlayerElement.SET, GAIN, or LOSE
        etype - Element type, such as SOCPlayerElement.PEType.SETTLEMENTS or SOCPlayerElement.PEType.NUMKNIGHTS. Does nothing if null.
        amount - The new value to set, or the delta to gain/lose
        nickname - Our client player nickname/username, for the only element where that matters: SOCPlayerElement.PEType.RESOURCE_COUNT. Can be null otherwise.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • handlePLAYERELEMENT_simple

        public static void handlePLAYERELEMENT_simple(SOCGame ga,
                                              SOCPlayer pl,
                                              int pn,
                                              int action,
                                              SOCPlayerElement.PEType etype,
                                              int val,
                                              java.lang.String nickname)
        Update game data for a simple player element or flag, for handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCGame, SOCPlayer, int, int, SOCPlayerElement.PEType, int, String). Handles ASK_SPECIAL_BUILD, NUM_PICK_GOLD_HEX_RESOURCES, SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT, etc.

        To avoid code duplication, also called from MessageHandler.handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCPlayerElement) and SOCRobotBrain.run().

        Before v2.0.00 this method directly took a SOCPlayerElement instead of that message's action, etype, and val fields.

        Parameters:
        ga - Game to update
        pl - Player to update; some elements take null. If null and pn != -1, will find pl using ga.getPlayer(pn).
        pn - Player number from message (sometimes -1 for none)
        action - SOCPlayerElement.SET, GAIN, or LOSE
        etype - Element type, such as SOCPlayerElement.PEType.SETTLEMENTS or SOCPlayerElement.PEType.NUMKNIGHTS. Does nothing if null.
        val - The new value to set, or the delta to gain/lose
        nickname - Our client player nickname/username, for the only element where that matters: SOCPlayerElement.PEType.RESOURCE_COUNT. Can be null otherwise.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • handlePLAYERELEMENT_numPieces

        public static void handlePLAYERELEMENT_numPieces(SOCPlayer pl,
                                                 int action,
                                                 int pieceType,
                                                 int amount)
        Update a player's amount of a playing piece, for handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCGame, SOCPlayer, int, int, SOCPlayerElement.PEType, int, String). To avoid code duplication, also called from MessageHandler.handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCPlayerElement) and SOCRobotBrain.run().

        Before v2.0.00 this method directly took a SOCPlayerElement instead of that message's action and amount fields.

        Parameters:
        pl - Player to update
        action - SOCPlayerElement.SET, GAIN, or LOSE
        pieceType - Playing piece type, like SOCPlayingPiece.ROAD
        amount - The new value to set, or the delta to gain/lose
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • handlePLAYERELEMENT_numRsrc

        public static void handlePLAYERELEMENT_numRsrc(SOCPlayer pl,
                                               int action,
                                               int rtype,
                                               int amount)
        Update a player's amount of a resource, for handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCGame, SOCPlayer, int, int, SOCPlayerElement.PEType, int, String).
        • If this is a SOCPlayerElement.LOSE action, and the player does not have enough of that type, the rest are taken from the player's UNKNOWN amount.
        • If we are losing from type UNKNOWN, first convert player's known resources to unknown resources (individual amount information will be lost), then remove mes's unknown resources from player.

        To avoid code duplication, also called from MessageHandler.handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCPlayerElement) and SOCRobotBrain.run().

        Before v2.0.00 this method directly took a SOCPlayerElement instead of that message's action and amount fields.

        Parameters:
        pl - Player to update
        action - SOCPlayerElement.SET, GAIN, or LOSE
        rtype - Type of resource, like SOCResourceConstants.CLAY
        amount - The new value to set, or the delta to gain/lose
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • handleCANCELBUILDREQUEST

        protected void handleCANCELBUILDREQUEST(SOCCancelBuildRequest mes)
        handle the rare "cancel build request" message; usually not sent from server to client.

        - When sent from client to server, CANCELBUILDREQUEST means the player has changed their mind about spending resources to build a piece. Only allowed during normal game play (PLACING_ROAD, PLACING_SETTLEMENT, or PLACING_CITY).

        When sent from server to client:

        - During game startup (START1B or START2B):
        Sent from server, CANCELBUILDREQUEST means the current player wants to undo the placement of their initial settlement. This handler method calls ga.undoPutInitSettlement (new SOCSettlement (currPlayer.getLastSettlementCoord())).

        - During piece placement (PLACING_ROAD, PLACING_CITY, PLACING_SETTLEMENT, PLACING_FREE_ROAD1 or PLACING_FREE_ROAD2):

        Sent from server, CANCELBUILDREQUEST means the player has sent an illegal PUTPIECE (bad building location). Humans can probably decide a better place to put their road, but robots must cancel the build request and decide on a new plan.

        Our client can ignore this case, because the server also sends a text message that the human player is capable of reading and acting on.

        Parameters:
        mes - the message
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • handleMOVEROBBER

        protected void handleMOVEROBBER(SOCMoveRobber mes)
        handle the "robber moved" or "pirate moved" message.
        Parameters:
        mes - the message

      • handleREPORTROBBERY

        public static void handleREPORTROBBERY(SOCReportRobbery mes,
                                       SOCGame ga)
        Handle the "report robbery" message. Updates game data by calling handlePLAYERELEMENT_numRsrc(SOCPlayer, int, int, int) or handlePLAYERELEMENT(SOCGame, SOCPlayer, int, int, SOCPlayerElement.PEType, int, String). Does nothing if mes.isGainLose but mes.amount == 0 and SOCReportRobbery.resSet is null.

        This method is public static for access by SOCPlayerClient and robot client classes.

        Parameters:
        mes - the message
        ga - game object for mes.getGameNameName(); if null, message is ignored
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • handleSETSPECIALITEM

        public static void handleSETSPECIALITEM(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SOCGame> games,
                                        SOCSetSpecialItem mes)
        Handle the "set special item" message. This method handles only OP_SET and OP_CLEAR (and the "set" or "clear" part of OP_SET_PICK and OP_CLEAR_PICK), and ignores other operations such as OP_PICK and OP_DECLINE. If your client needs to react to PICK or other operations, override this method or check SOCSetSpecialItem.op and call something else for those ops.
        Parameters:
        games - Games the client is playing, for method reuse by SOCPlayerClient
        mes - the message
        Since:
        2.0.00

                              int itype)
        Send a request to play a SOCInventoryItem (not a standard SOCDevCard) using a SOCInventoryItemAction(ourPN, PLAY, itype, rc=0) message.
        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        ourPN - our player's player number
        itype - the special inventory item type picked by player, from SOCInventoryItem.itype
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • sendText

        public void sendText(SOCGame ga,
                     java.lang.String me)
        send a text message to the people in the game
        Parameters:
        ga - the game; does nothing if null
        me - the message

      • leaveGame

        public void leaveGame(SOCGame ga)
        user wants to leave a game.
        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        See Also:
        leaveGame(String)

      • leaveGame

        public void leaveGame(java.lang.String gaName)
        user wants to leave a game, which they may not have been able to fully join.
        Parameters:
        gaName - the game name
        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        leaveGame(SOCGame)

        Parameters:

                    SOCResourceSet rs)

        Parameters:

        rs - Resources to discard

      • choosePlayer

        public void choosePlayer(SOCGame ga,
                         int ch)
        The user chose a player to steal from, or (game state GameState.WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE) chose whether to move the robber or the pirate, or (game state GameState.WAITING_FOR_ROB_CLOTH_OR_RESOURCE) chose whether to steal a resource or cloth.
        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        ch - the player number, or SOCChoosePlayer.CHOICE_MOVE_ROBBER to move the robber or SOCChoosePlayer.CHOICE_MOVE_PIRATE to move the pirate ship. See SOCChoosePlayer.SOCChoosePlayer(String, int) for meaning of ch for game state WAITING_FOR_ROB_CLOTH_OR_RESOURCE.

      • rejectOffer

        public void rejectOffer(SOCGame ga)
        the user is rejecting the current offers
        Parameters:
        ga - the game

      • acceptOffer

        public void acceptOffer(SOCGame ga,
                        int from)
        the user is accepting an offer
        Parameters:

        from - the number of the player that is making the offer

      • clearOffer

        public void clearOffer(SOCGame ga)
        the user is clearing an offer
        Parameters:
        ga - the game

      • bankTrade

        public void bankTrade(SOCGame theGame,
                      SOCResourceSet give,
                      SOCResourceSet get,
                      int playerNumber)
        the client wants to trade with the bank or a port. This does not actually execute the trade, but merely sends a trade request to the server.
        Parameters:
        theGame - the game
        give - what is being offered
        get - what the player wants
        playerNumber - the player number requesting the trade; the server can compare this to the current player to make sure he can request a trade.

      • offerTrade

        public void offerTrade(SOCGame ga,
                       SOCTradeOffer offer)
        the user is making an offer to trade with other players.
        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        offer - the trade offer

                        int devCardType)

        Parameters:

        devCardType - the type of development card

      • pickResources

        public void pickResources(SOCGame ga,
                          SOCResourceSet rscs)
        the user picked 2 resources to discover (Discovery/Year of Plenty), or picked these resources to gain from a gold hex.

        Before v2.0.00, this method was discoveryPick(..).

        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        rscs - the resources

      • pickResourceType

        public void pickResourceType(SOCGame ga,
                             int res)
        the client player picked a resource type to monopolize.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was monopolyPick.

        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        res - the resource type, such as SOCResourceConstants.CLAY or SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP

                       int id)

      • setSeatLock

        public void setSeatLock(SOCGame ga,
                        int pn,
                        SOCGame.SeatLockState sl)
        The user is locking or unlocking a seat.
        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        pn - the seat number
        sl - new seat lock state; remember that servers older than v2.0.00 won't recognize CLEAR_ON_RESET
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Connection to server has raised an error that wasn't InterruptedIOException; ex contains exception detail. Leave all games, then disconnect.

        SOCRobotClient overrides this to try and reconnect.
